item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: https://192.168.224.64/ccis-ispsc.edu.ph.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Sample Page (Copy)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Academics
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CCIS PROGRAMS OFFERED

Vision

A vibrant and nurturing Polytechnic Service College for transforming lives and communities.

Mission

To improve the lives of people and communities through quality instruction, innovations, productivity, initiatives, environment and industry-feasible technologies, resource mobilization and transformational outreach programs and services.

Goals and Objectives

  1. To make the college responsive and relevant to the individual and social needs for optimum human development.
  2. To offer priority programs in tourism, teacher education, agriculture fishery, agro-forestry, trades, business industry and Information technology which will generate knowledge base to educate the people and communities.
  3. To conduct a wide-range of research and extension programs to provide quality training and technologies for inclusive growth.
  4. To implement government programs and thrusts in the context of regional and national development for poverty alleviation.
  5. To prepare and develop highly productive and employable professionals, “glocal” (global and local) technopreneurs who are morally-crafted and environmentally-oriented for coping globalization standards.

Programs Offered:

BSCS Bachelor of Science in Computer Science The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (BSCS) program delves into the fundamental theories and principles of computation, algorithms, and software design. Students develop strong analytical and problem-solving skills, learning to innovate and build complex software systems from the ground up. This program prepares you to become a skilled software developer, researcher, or innovator, capable of pushing the boundaries of technology in areas like artificial intelligence, data science, and advanced programming. Read More BSIT Bachelor of Science in Information Technology The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology (BSIT) program focuses on the practical application of computing to solve real-world organizational challenges. Students gain expertise in managing information systems, network administration, database management, web development, and cybersecurity. This program equips you with the hands-on skills needed to implement, maintain, and support technology solutions for businesses and industries, ensuring efficient and secure IT operations. Read More

Contact Information

Dr. Vitruvius John D. Barayuga

Program Head

Email: abcdefgh@gmail.com

Contact Number: 09123456789

{"timeout":1750920414,"value":{"content":"

CCIS PROGRAMS OFFERED

Vision

[elementor-element k="552a7e28b69627dc2839c24b13ba2c4a" data=""]

Mission

[elementor-element k="552a7e28b69627dc2839c24b13ba2c4a" data=""]

Goals and Objectives

[elementor-element k="552a7e28b69627dc2839c24b13ba2c4a" data=""]

Programs Offered:

BSCS
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (BSCS) program delves into the fundamental theories and principles of computation, algorithms, and software design. Students develop strong analytical and problem-solving skills, learning to innovate and build complex software systems from the ground up. This program prepares you to become a skilled software developer, researcher, or innovator, capable of pushing the boundaries of technology in areas like artificial intelligence, data science, and advanced programming.
Read More
BSIT
Bachelor of Science in Information Technology
The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology (BSIT) program focuses on the practical application of computing to solve real-world organizational challenges. Students gain expertise in managing information systems, network administration, database management, web development, and cybersecurity. This program equips you with the hands-on skills needed to implement, maintain, and support technology solutions for businesses and industries, ensuring efficient and secure IT operations.
Read More

Contact Information

[elementor-element k="552a7e28b69627dc2839c24b13ba2c4a" data=""][elementor-element k="552a7e28b69627dc2839c24b13ba2c4a" data=""][elementor-element k="552a7e28b69627dc2839c24b13ba2c4a" data=""][elementor-element k="552a7e28b69627dc2839c24b13ba2c4a" data=""]
","scripts":[],"styles":[]}}

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CCIS BULLETIN

Dive into the world of CCIS with our newest bulletin!

Top Stories

CS Ball: A Night of Connection CS Ball: A Night of Connection is an exclusive formal event designed to bring together the brightest... Read More Crack the Code: The Ultimate Challenge This highly anticipated event invites participants to delve into a series of intricate problems, challenging... Read More Hello, Real World: Day One of OJT Today marks the highly anticipated first day of my On-the-Job Training, a pivotal moment where I’ll transition... Read More
  • Timezone UTC+6
  • Speaker
  • Address

Read More

PROGRAMS OFFERED

College of Computing and Information Sciences offers 2 main programs

BSCS Bachelor of Science in Computer Science The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science program provides a strong foundation in computing concepts, algorithmic principles, and software engineering, preparing graduates for careers in software design, algorithm development, and building complex computing systems, as well as for research. Read More BSIT The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology program equips students with practical, industry-relevant IT skills in network administration, systems development, database management, and IT support through hands-on learning, preparing them for diverse IT careers. Read More

CCIS and the UN Sustainable Development Goals

AfterBefore

The College of Computing and Information Sciences (CCIS) deeply integrates the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) into its core mission. We use logic and innovation to create impactful solutions for a more sustainable and equitable world.

CCIS empowers students and faculty to develop technology-driven solutions for global challenges, directly contributing to the SDGs. Through research and community engagement, we build a future that is both technologically advanced and truly sustainable.

CONTACT US

We're here to answer your inquiries and provide the support you need.

Ask How We Can Help You

We’d love to hear from you. Whether you have questions, feedback, or just want to say hi, our team is here and ready to listen. Fill out the form beside this message, and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can. Let’s connect and make things happen — together.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Études offers comprehensive consulting, management, design, and research solutions. Every architectural endeavor is an opportunity to shape the future.

Leaving an indelible mark on the landscape of tomorrow.

About us

The revitalized art gallery is set to redefine cultural landscape.

With meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to excellence, we create spaces that inspire, elevate, and enrich the lives of those who inhabit them.

The revitalized Art Gallery is set to redefine the cultural landscape of Toronto, serving as a nexus of artistic expression, community engagement, and architectural marvel. The expansion and renovation project pay homage to the Art Gallery's rich history while embracing the future, ensuring that the gallery remains a beacon of inspiration.

The revitalized Art Gallery is set to redefine the cultural landscape of Toronto, serving as a nexus of artistic expression, community engagement, and architectural marvel. The expansion and renovation project pay homage to the Art Gallery's rich history while embracing the future, ensuring that the gallery remains a beacon of inspiration.

Guiding your business through the project

Experience the fusion of imagination and expertise with Études—the catalyst for architectural transformations that enrich the world around us.

Our services

Meet our team

Our comprehensive suite of professionals caters to a diverse team, ranging from seasoned architects to renowned engineers.

Francesca Piovani

Founder, CEO & Architect

Rhye Moore

Engineering Manager

Helga Steiner

Architect

Ivan Lawrence

Project Manager

We’ve worked with some of the best companies.

FAQs

What is your process working in smaller projects?

Études offers comprehensive consulting, management, design, and research solutions. Our vision is to be at the forefront of architectural innovation, fostering a global community of architects and enthusiasts united by a passion for creating spaces. Every architectural endeavor is an opportunity to shape the future.

Who is behind Études?

Études offers comprehensive consulting, management, design, and research solutions. Our vision is to be at the forefront of architectural innovation, fostering a global community of architects and enthusiasts united by a passion for creating spaces. Every architectural endeavor is an opportunity to shape the future.

I'd like to get to meet fellow architects, how can I do that?

Études offers comprehensive consulting, management, design, and research solutions. Our vision is to be at the forefront of architectural innovation, fostering a global community of architects and enthusiasts united by a passion for creating spaces. Every architectural endeavor is an opportunity to shape the future.

Can I apply to be a part of the team or work as a contractor?

Études offers comprehensive consulting, management, design, and research solutions. Our vision is to be at the forefront of architectural innovation, fostering a global community of architects and enthusiasts united by a passion for creating spaces. Every architectural endeavor is an opportunity to shape the future.

Enhance your architectural journey with the Études Architect app.

  • Collaborate with fellow architects.
  • Showcase your projects.
  • Experience the world of architecture.
Download app

item.title: BS Computer Science
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

Program Description

The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science program emphasizes computing concepts and theories, algorithmic foundations, and innovations in computing. The curriculum aims to prepare graduates for careers in software design, algorithm development, and the creation of complex computing systems. The program also focuses on software engineering, databases, and large-scale systems, equipping graduates with a solid foundation for both industry and research.

Vision

A vibrant and nurturing Polytechnic Service College for transforming lives and communities.

Mission

To improve the lives of people and communities through quality instruction, innovations, productivity, initiatives, environment and industry-feasible technologies, resource mobilization and transformational outreach programs and services.

Goals and Objectives

  1. To make the college responsive and relevant to the individual and social needs for optimum human development.
  2. To offer priority programs in tourism, teacher education, agriculture fishery, agro-forestry, trades, business industry and Information technology which will generate knowledge base to educate the people and communities.
  3. To conduct a wide-range of research and extension programs to provide quality training and technologies for inclusive growth.
  4. To implement government programs and thrusts in the context of regional and national development for poverty alleviation.
  5. To prepare and develop highly productive and employable professionals, “glocal” (global and local) technopreneurs who are morally-crafted and environmentally-oriented for coping globalization standards.

CS Week: Beyond the Terminal

Innovate, Connect, Play: Exploring Horizons Together!

Join us for CS Week! While we dive deep into bytes and algorithms, we also believe in building a strong community. Experience the thrill of teamwork through lively outdoor games and connect with fellow CS enthusiasts. It's a week to balance intellectual growth with unforgettable fun, truly exploring boundless horizons together.

The CS Ball: A Night of Recognition

Celebrating Excellence in Computer Science

Step into the spotlight at our annual CS Ball! Join us to celebrate the outstanding accomplishments, academic excellence, and impactful innovations within our Computer Science department. This evening is dedicated to honoring the brilliant minds shaping tomorrow's technology.

CS Week: The Build Challenge

Unraveling the Machine: Hands-On PC Assembly

CS Week is bringing theory to life with its PC Assembly Challenge. This event offers participants a practical deep-dive into computer hardware, building systems from the ground up to enhance their understanding and skills. It's a key part of exploring boundless horizons in bytes and algorithms, bridging the gap between code and component.

Why choose BS Computer Science?

  • Specialized Majors: Choose from two in-demand majors: Embedded Systems and AI, or Software Engineering, allowing for focused expertise.
  • Industry-Relevant Curriculum: Our courses are regularly updated to reflect the latest advancements and industry best practices.
  • Experienced Faculty: Learn from dedicated professors with academic expertise and practical industry experience.
  • Hands-on Learning: Emphasis on practical projects, laboratory exercises, and real-world case studies.
  • Career Opportunities: Graduates are well-prepared for entry-level to advanced positions in a wide array of tech industries.

BS Computer Science Majors:

BS Computer Science Major in Embedded Systems and Artificial Intelligence Unlock the future of technology with our BS Computer Science major in Embedded Systems and Artificial Intelligence. This program fuses the power of intelligent algorithms with real-world hardware, empowering you to design, build, and innovate smart devices, IoT solutions, robotics, and next-generation AI applications directly on embedded systems. Prepare for a career at the forefront of digital innovation. Read More BS Computer Science Major in Software Engineering Become an architect of the digital world with our BS Computer Science major in Software Engineering. This program focuses on the systematic design, development, testing, and maintenance of high-quality, scalable, and robust software solutions. You'll master coding, algorithms, data structures, and best practices to build the applications and systems that power modern life, from mobile apps to complex enterprise platforms. Shape the future, one line of code at a time. Read More

Contact Information

Dr. Vitruvius John D. Barayuga

Program Head

Email: abcdefgh@gmail.com

Contact Number: 09123456789

Why choose BS Computer Science?

[elementor-element k="552a7e28b69627dc2839c24b13ba2c4a" data=""]

BS Computer Science Majors:

BS Computer Science Major in
Embedded Systems and Artificial Intelligence
Unlock the future of technology with our BS Computer Science major in Embedded Systems and Artificial Intelligence. This program fuses the power of intelligent algorithms with real-world hardware, empowering you to design, build, and innovate smart devices, IoT solutions, robotics, and next-generation AI applications directly on embedded systems. Prepare for a career at the forefront of digital innovation.
Read More
BS Computer Science Major in
Software Engineering
Become an architect of the digital world with our BS Computer Science major in Software Engineering. This program focuses on the systematic design, development, testing, and maintenance of high-quality, scalable, and robust software solutions. You'll master coding, algorithms, data structures, and best practices to build the applications and systems that power modern life, from mobile apps to complex enterprise platforms. Shape the future, one line of code at a time.
Read More

item.title: BS Information Technology
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Bachelor of Science in Information technology

Program Description

The BS in Information Technology program includes the study of the utilization of both hardware and software technologies involving planning, installing, customizing, operating, managing and administering and maintaining information technology infrastructure that provides computing solutions to address the needs of an organization. The program prepares graduates to address various user needs involving the selection, development, application, integration and management of computing technologies within an organization.

Vision

A vibrant and nurturing Polytechnic Service College for transforming lives and communities.

Mission

To improve the lives of people and communities through quality instruction, innovations, productivity, initiatives, environment and industry-feasible technologies, resource mobilization and transformational outreach programs and services.

Goals and Objectives

  1. To make the college responsive and relevant to the individual and social needs for optimum human development.
  2. To offer priority programs in tourism, teacher education, agriculture fishery, agro-forestry, trades, business industry and Information technology which will generate knowledge base to educate the people and communities.
  3. To conduct a wide-range of research and extension programs to provide quality training and technologies for inclusive growth.
  4. To implement government programs and thrusts in the context of regional and national development for poverty alleviation.
  5. To prepare and develop highly productive and employable professionals, “glocal” (global and local) technopreneurs who are morally-crafted and environmentally-oriented for coping globalization standards.

BSIT Tour: Tech Unveiled

From Classroom to Real-World IT

BSIT students recently explored the practical side of IT on an educational tour. They gained hands-on experience with equipment, bridging the gap between theory and real-world applications.

IT Week: Digital Arena Showdown

Code & Conquer: BSIT Unleashes Esports Excellence

The Information Technology Student Organization (ITSO) of Ilocos Sur Polytechnic State College - Candon Campus proudly presents a thrilling highlight of IT Week: the Mobile Legends Intramurals 2024! This event transcends mere gaming, showcasing the strategic thinking, quick reflexes, and technical prowess honed by our BSIT students. It's where networking knowledge meets competitive spirit, and system optimization fuels digital domination. Join us as our future IT professionals demonstrate their skills, proving that innovation thrives both in the lab and on the digital battlefield!

Congratulations, IT Batch 2025!

Forging Futures in the Digital Landscape

The Information Technology Student Organization (ITSO) of Ilocos Sur Polytechnic State College - Candon Campus proudly extends its heartfelt congratulations to the graduating Batch 2025! As you don your academic regalia, we celebrate your perseverance, dedication, and remarkable achievements throughout your journey in Information Technology. You are now equipped with the knowledge and skills to navigate and innovate in the ever-evolving digital world. We wish you immense success as you embark on your next chapter, ready to make your mark as the IT professionals of tomorrow!

Why choose BS Information Technology?

  • Practical & Applied Focus: Emphasizes hands-on skills directly applicable to IT roles.
  • Diverse Skill Set: Develop expertise in networking, databases, web development, and system administration.
  • Problem-Solving: Learn to analyze and solve IT-related challenges faced by organizations.
  • Industry Certifications: The curriculum may align with various industry certifications, enhancing employability.
  • Versatile Career Paths: Prepare for roles across various industries that rely heavily on IT.

Program Outcomes:

The program prepares students to be Information Systems Officers or professionals in both local and global context who are expected to design and implement solutions that integrate Information Technology with business processes. A sound understanding of organizational principles and practices so that they can serve as effective bridges between the technical and management communities within the organization; as well as engaged in life-long learning endeavors which are capable of contributing in research, extension and resource generation in the field of Information Systems.

Potential Career Paths

  • Software Developer / Engineer
  • Web Developer
  • Data Analyst
  • Information Security Analyst
  • Network Administrator

Curriculum

Contact Information

Mr. Ariel A. Dela Cruz

Program Head

Email: abcdefgh@gmail.com

item.title: Major in Software Engineering
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Software engineering

What is Software Engineering?

The Software Engineering major within the BSCS program provides a comprehensive and systematic approach to the design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of high-quality software solutions. This specialization emphasizes engineering principles, methodologies, and tools to build robust, scalable, and secure software applications.

Students will gain proficiency in various programming paradigms, software architecture, database management, web development, mobile application development, and software project management. The curriculum also focuses on best practices for collaborative development, quality assurance, and software lifecycle management.

 

Vision

A vibrant and nurturing Polytechnic Service College for transforming lives and communities.

Mission

To improve the lives of people and communities through quality instruction, innovations, productivity, initiatives, environment and industry-feasible technologies, resource mobilization and transformational outreach programs and services.

Goals and Objectives

  1. To make the college responsive and relevant to the individual and social needs for optimum human development.
  2. To offer priority programs in tourism, teacher education, agriculture fishery, agro-forestry, trades, business industry and Information technology which will generate knowledge base to educate the people and communities.
  3. To conduct a wide range of research and extension programs to provide quality training and technologies for inclusive growth.
  4. To implement government programs and thrusts in the context of regional and national development for poverty alleviation.
  5. To prepare and develop highly productive and employable professionals, “glocal” (global and local) technopreneurs who are morally crafted and environmentally oriented for coping globalization standards.

Program Outcomes

  1. Applying knowledge and computing fundamentals, knowledge of a computing specialization, and mathematics, science, and domain knowledge appropriate for the computing specialization to the abstraction and conceptualization of computing models from defined problems and requirements.
  2. Identify, analyze, formulate, research literature, and solve complex computing problems and requirements reaching substantiated conclusions using fundamental principles of mathematics, computing sciences, and relevant domain disciplines.
  3. Apply mathematical foundations, algorithmic principles and computing problems and design of computer-based systems in a way that demonstrates comprehension of the tradeoffs involved in designs choices.
  4. Display knowledge and understanding of information security issues in relation to design, development and use of information.
  5. Design and evaluate solutions for complex computing problems, and design and evaluate system, components, or processes that meet specified needs with appropriate considerations.
  6. Create, select, adapt and apply appropriate techniques, resources and modern computing tools to complex computing activities, with an understanding of the limitations to accomplish a common goal.
  7. Function effectively as an individual and as a member or leader in diverse teams and in multidisciplinary settings
  8. Communicate effectively with the computing community and with society at large about complex computing activities by being able to comprehend and write effective reports, design documentation, make effective presentation, and give and understand clear instructions.
  9. Recognize the legal, social and professional issues involved in the utilization of computer technology and be guide by the adoption of appropriate professional, ethical and legal practices.
  10. Engage in independent learning of continual development as a computing professional.

Curriculum

Admission Process:

  1. Secure Application Form: Obtain the application form from the ISPSC Main Campus Admissions Office or download it from our website.
  2. Submit Requirements: Submit the accomplished application form along with all required documents to the Admissions Office.
  3. Schedule Entrance Exam: The Admissions Office will provide you with a schedule and details for the (ICAT).
  4. Take the Entrance Exam: Be present on your scheduled date and time for the ICAT.
  5. Interview (if applicable): Some programs, especially within CCIS, may require an interview as part of the admission process to assess aptitude and interest.
  6. Release of Results: Check the official ISPSC Main Campus bulletin boards or website for the list of qualified applicants on [Specify Date].
  7. Enrollment: Successful applicants will be given instructions for enrollment procedures.

Potential Career Paths

  • Software Engineer / Developer
  • Full-Stack Developer
  • Front-End Developer
  • Back-End Developer
  • Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer
  • DevOps Engineer
  • Solutions Architect
  • Database Administrator (DBA)
  • Technical Project Manager
  • Mobile App Developer
  • Game Developer
  • Embedded Software Engineer
  • Cloud Engineer
  • Cybersecurity Engineer
  • Machine Learning Engineer
  • UI/UX Engineer

Contact Information

Dr. Vitruvius John D. Barayuga

Program Head

Email: abcdefgh@gmail.com

The <\/span>Software Engineering<\/b> major within the BSCS program provides a comprehensive and systematic approach to the design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of high-quality software solutions. This specialization emphasizes engineering principles, methodologies, and tools to build robust, scalable, and secure software applications.<\/span><\/p>

Students will gain proficiency in various programming paradigms, software architecture, database management, web development, mobile application development, and software project management. The curriculum also focuses on best practices for collaborative development, quality assurance, and software lifecycle management.<\/span><\/p>

    1. Applying knowledge and computing fundamentals, knowledge of a computing specialization, and mathematics, science, and domain knowledge appropriate for the computing specialization to the abstraction and conceptualization of computing models from defined problems and requirements.<\/span><\/li>
    2. Identify, analyze, formulate, research literature, and solve complex computing problems and requirements reaching substantiated conclusions using fundamental principles of mathematics, computing sciences, and relevant domain disciplines.<\/span><\/li>
    3. Apply mathematical foundations, algorithmic principles and computing problems and design of computer-based systems in a way that demonstrates comprehension of the tradeoffs involved in designs choices.<\/span><\/li>
    4. Display knowledge and understanding of information security issues in relation to design, development and use of information.<\/span><\/li>
    5. Design and evaluate solutions for complex computing problems, and design and evaluate system, components, or processes that meet specified needs with appropriate considerations.<\/span><\/li>
    6. Create, select, adapt and apply appropriate techniques, resources and modern computing tools to complex computing activities, with an understanding of the limitations to accomplish a common goal.<\/span><\/li>
    7. Function effectively as an individual and as a member or leader in diverse teams and in multidisciplinary settings<\/span><\/li>
    8. Communicate effectively with the computing community and with society at large about complex computing activities by being able to comprehend and write effective reports, design documentation, make effective presentation, and give and understand clear instructions.<\/span><\/li>
    9. Recognize the legal, social and professional issues involved in the utilization of computer technology and be guide by the adoption of appropriate professional, ethical and legal practices.<\/span><\/li>
    10. Engage in independent learning of continual development as a computing professional.<\/span><\/li><\/ol>","align":"justify","text_color":"#000000","_flex_size":"none","ha_cmc_text":"Happy       1. Secure Application Form<\/b>: Obtain the application form from the ISPSC Main Campus Admissions Office or download it from our website.<\/span><\/li>
      2. Submit Requirements<\/b>: Submit the accomplished application form along with all required documents to the Admissions Office.<\/span><\/li>
      3. Schedule Entrance Exam<\/b>: The Admissions Office will provide you with a schedule and details for the (ICAT).<\/span><\/li>
      4. Take the Entrance Exam<\/b>: Be present on your scheduled date and time for the ICAT.<\/span><\/li>
      5. Interview (if applicable)<\/b>: Some programs, especially within CCIS, may require an interview as part of the admission process to assess aptitude and interest.<\/span><\/li>
      6. Release of Results<\/b>: Check the official ISPSC Main Campus bulletin boards or website for the list of qualified applicants on [Specify Date].<\/span><\/li>

item.title: Vision and Mission
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
VISION AND MISSION

VISION

A vibrant and nurturing Polytechnic Service College for transforming lives and communities.

Filipino: (Pangitain) Maningning at mapag-arugang politeknikong serbisyo-kolehiyo para sa pagpapaunlad ng buhay at lipunan.

Iloco: (Sirmata) Narimat ken managtaripato nga serbisyo-kolehiyo politekniko para ti pannakabalbaliw iti biag ken kagimongan.

MISSION

To improve the lives of people and communities through quality instruction, innovations, productivity, initiatives, environment and industry-feasible technologies, resource mobilization and transformational outreach programs and services.

Filipino: Mapaunlad ang buhay ng tao at lipunan sa pamamagitan ng de-kalidad na pagtuturo, pagkamalikhain, panguguna sa pagiging produktibo, teknolohiyang pangkapaligiran at industria, tamang paggamit ng pinagkukunang yaman at mga program at serbisyong makapagbabago sa kabuhayan.

Iloco: Mapadur-as iti panagbiag dagiti tattao ken gimong babaen iti de-kalidad a panagisuro, panagpartuat, nabunga ken naballigi a gannuat, teknolohiya a mangsaluad iti aglawlaw ken iti industria, naikalintegan a panagusar dagiti pagbaknangan ken pannakaipaay iti programa ken serbisyo nga mangidanon iti panagbalbaliw.​

Contact Information

Dr. Vitruvius John D. Barayuga

Program Head

Email: abcdefgh@gmail.com

Contact Number: 09123456789

{"timeout":1750917088,"value":{"content":"

VISION AND MISSION

VISION

A vibrant and nurturing Polytechnic Service College for transforming lives and communities.

Filipino: (Pangitain) Maningning at mapag-arugang politeknikong serbisyo-kolehiyo para sa pagpapaunlad ng buhay at lipunan.

Iloco: (Sirmata) Narimat ken managtaripato nga serbisyo-kolehiyo politekniko para ti pannakabalbaliw iti biag ken kagimongan.

MISSION

To improve the lives of people and communities through quality instruction, innovations, productivity, initiatives, environment and industry-feasible technologies, resource mobilization and transformational outreach programs and services.

Filipino: Mapaunlad ang buhay ng tao at lipunan sa pamamagitan ng de-kalidad na pagtuturo, pagkamalikhain, panguguna sa pagiging produktibo, teknolohiyang pangkapaligiran at industria, tamang paggamit ng pinagkukunang yaman at mga program at serbisyong makapagbabago sa kabuhayan.

Iloco: Mapadur-as iti panagbiag dagiti tattao ken gimong babaen iti de-kalidad a panagisuro, panagpartuat, nabunga ken naballigi a gannuat, teknolohiya a mangsaluad iti aglawlaw ken iti industria, naikalintegan a panagusar dagiti pagbaknangan ken pannakaipaay iti programa ken serbisyo nga mangidanon iti panagbalbaliw.​

Contact Information

item.title: College Life

item.content:encoded:
COLLEGE LIFE

CCIS News

  • CS Ball: A Night of Connection

  • Crack the Code: The Ultimate Challenge

  • Hello, Real World: Day One of OJT

Witness the CSSO in Action!

Don't miss the CSSO (Council of Student Organizations) video! It's your window into the heart of our vibrant student community, showcasing diverse clubs and impactful projects. Discover how CSSO champions student life, and find countless ways to get involved, develop skills, and make connections. See the passion and possibilities – it's where you can truly thrive!

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
ABOUT US

Empowering the next generation of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity specialists, and IT leaders by providing a dynamic and inclusive environment that emphasizes hands-on learning, interdisciplinary research, and real-world problem-solving. Through innovative curricula, cutting-edge technology labs, industry partnerships, and experiential learning opportunities, we prepare students to lead and innovate in a rapidly evolving digital world.

Contact Information

Dr. Vitruvius John D. Barayuga

Program Head

Email: abcdefgh@gmail.com

Contact Number: 09123456789

item.title: News and Events
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
News and events

Celebrating Excellence: Congratulations to the BSIT Graduates of Batch 2025!

The entire Ilocos Sur Polytechnic State College - Main Campus community extends its warmest congratulations to the brilliant Bachelor of Science in Information Technology (BSIT) graduating Class of 2025!

This marks a significant milestone for our graduates who have diligently navigated the dynamic and ever-evolving landscape of information technology. Through rigorous coursework, hands-on projects, and unwavering dedication, Batch 2025 has demonstrated exceptional skill and readiness to contribute to the digital world.

As you step into your respective career paths – whether it be in network administration, cybersecurity, web development, database management, or IT support – remember the knowledge and practical expertise gained during your time with us. Your hard work, perseverance, and commitment to learning have truly paid off.

The faculty and staff are immensely proud of your achievements and confident that you are well-equipped to tackle the challenges and seize the opportunities that lie ahead in the IT industry.

Congratulations once again, Batch 2025! We wish you all the best in your future endeavors and look forward to witnessing your impact on the world.

CS Week Culminates in Glittering CS Ball: Honoring Academic and Competitive Success

The 2025 CS Ball brought a spectacular close to CS Week, celebrating the remarkable achievements of our Computer Science students. The evening's program featured a special tribute to our Dean's List students, acknowledging their outstanding academic performance and dedication. We also celebrated the talented winners of the CS Week competitions, whose innovative projects and competitive spirit made the week such a success. The event was a fantastic opportunity to recognize the hard work and dedication of our students, and to celebrate the vibrant community we've created within the Computer Science department. Congratulations to everyone who contributed to such a memorable week!

Embarking on Innovation: Third-Year Students Kick Off Project-Based Software Development OJT

College of Computing and Information is thrilled to announce the launch of its Project-Based Software Development On-the-Job Training (OJT) program for third-year students, starting today, June 25, 2025. This innovative initiative provides unparalleled real-world experience, allowing aspiring software engineers to immediately apply their knowledge to authentic challenges. Under faculty and industry mentorship, students will develop practical skills in an environment mirroring professional software development cycles, contributing to their robust portfolio and preparing them as highly skilled, industry-ready professionals.

Educational Training: Charting Your Course for Future Success

Our educational training programs are meticulously crafted to provide a truly transformative learning experience, moving beyond traditional instruction to deliver cutting-edge knowledge and hands-on expertise. We are deeply committed to empowering you with the most relevant and in-demand skills that are critical for navigating and excelling within today's dynamic and ever-evolving professional landscape. Recognizing that continuous learning is paramount for sustained success, our curriculum is diligently and regularly updated, ensuring it always reflects the very latest industry trends, groundbreaking technological advancements, and universally recognized best practices. This forward-thinking approach ensures that the knowledge you gain is not just current, but truly future-proof, providing a robust foundation for your career.

Prepare to unlock your fullest potential as our training embraces an immersive, practical, and project-based learning methodology. This distinctive approach directly simulates real-world challenges and scenarios, guaranteeing that you're not merely absorbing theoretical concepts, but actively applying them to develop tangible solutions and innovate. Our programs are led by seasoned industry experts who bring a wealth of practical experience directly into the classroom, offering invaluable mentorship, actionable insights, and personalized guidance. This holistic educational experience is designed to significantly enhance your existing capabilities, sharpen your critical thinking, cultivate innovative problem-solving abilities, and broaden your strategic perspective.

Ultimately, our goal is to ensure you are not just competent, but exceptionally industry-ready and highly competitive from the moment you complete our specialized training. Investing in your professional development with us means taking a definitive step towards charting a successful and impactful career trajectory, prepared to lead and adapt in the fast-paced world.

item.title: Major in Embedded Systems & AI
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Embedded Systems and artificial intelligence

What is Embedded Systems and Artificial Intelligence?

The Embedded Systems and Artificial Intelligence (AI) major within the BSCS program focuses on the exciting convergence of intelligent systems and hardware. This specialization equips students with the skills to design, develop, and implement smart, autonomous systems that are integrated directly into devices and environments.

Students will delve into the core concepts of artificial intelligence, including machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, and natural language processing, while also gaining a deep understanding of microcontroller programming, real-time operating systems, sensor integration, and hardware-software co-design for embedded platforms.

Vision

A vibrant and nurturing Polytechnic Service College for transforming lives and communities.

Mission

To improve the lives of people and communities through quality instruction, innovations, productivity, initiatives, environment and industry-feasible technologies, resource mobilization and transformational outreach programs and services.

Goals and Objectives

  1. To make the college responsive and relevant to the individual and social needs for optimum human development.
  2. To offer priority programs in tourism, teacher education, agriculture fishery, agro-forestry, trades, business industry and Information technology which will generate knowledge base to educate the people and communities.
  3. To conduct a wide range of research and extension programs to provide quality training and technologies for inclusive growth.
  4. To implement government programs and thrusts in the context of regional and national development for poverty alleviation.
  5. To prepare and develop highly productive and employable professionals, “glocal” (global and local) technopreneurs who are morally crafted and environmentally oriented for coping globalization standards.

Program Outcomes

  1. Applying knowledge and computing fundamentals, knowledge of a computing specialization, and mathematics, science, and domain knowledge appropriate for the computing specialization to the abstraction and conceptualization of computing models from defined problems and requirements.
  2. Identify, analyze, formulate, research literature, and solve complex computing problems and requirements reaching substantiated conclusions using fundamental principles of mathematics, computing sciences, and relevant domain disciplines.
  3. Apply mathematical foundations, algorithmic principles and computing problems and design of computer-based systems in a way that demonstrates comprehension of the tradeoffs involved in designs choices.
  4. Display knowledge and understanding of information security issues in relation to design, development and use of information.
  5. Design and evaluate solutions for complex computing problems, and design and evaluate system, components, or processes that meet specified needs with appropriate considerations.
  6. Create, select, adapt and apply appropriate techniques, resources and modern computing tools to complex computing activities, with an understanding of the limitations to accomplish a common goal.
  7. Function effectively as an individual and as a member or leader in diverse teams and in multidisciplinary settings
  8. Communicate effectively with the computing community and with society at large about complex computing activities by being able to comprehend and write effective reports, design documentation, make effective presentation, and give and understand clear instructions.
  9. Recognize the legal, social and professional issues involved in the utilization of computer technology and be guide by the adoption of appropriate professional, ethical and legal practices.
  10. Engage in independent learning of continual development as a computing professional.

Curriculum

Admission Process:

  1. Secure Application Form: Obtain the application form from the ISPSC Main Campus Admissions Office or download it from our website.
  2. Submit Requirements: Submit the accomplished application form along with all required documents to the Admissions Office.
  3. Schedule Entrance Exam: The Admissions Office will provide you with a schedule and details for the (ICAT).
  4. Take the Entrance Exam: Be present on your scheduled date and time for the ICAT.
  5. Interview (if applicable): Some programs, especially within CCIS, may require an interview as part of the admission process to assess aptitude and interest.
  6. Release of Results: Check the official ISPSC Main Campus bulletin boards or website for the list of qualified applicants on [Specify Date].
  7. Enrollment: Successful applicants will be given instructions for enrollment procedures.

Potential Career Paths

  • Embedded Software Engineer
  • AI Engineer
  • Machine Learning Engineer
  • IoT Developer
  • Robotics Engineer
  • Firmware Developer
  • Automated Systems Designer
  • Hardware-Software Integration Engineer
  • Deep Learning Engineer
  • Computer Vision Engineer
  • Edge AI Engineer
  • Autonomous Systems Engineer
  • Real-time Systems Developer
  • Sensor Fusion Engineer
  • Applied AI Researcher
  • Control Systems Engineer

Contact Information

Dr. Vitruvius John D. Barayuga

Program Head

Email: abcdefgh@gmail.com

Contact Number: 09123456789

To prepare and develop highly productive and employable professionals, \u201cglocal\u201d (global and local) technopreneurs who are morally crafted and environmentally oriented for coping globalization standards.<\/li><\/ol>","align":"justify","text_color":"#000000","_flex_size":"none","ha_cmc_text":"Happy Addons","__globals__":{"typography_typography":"globals\/typography?id=958ae6f"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":true},{"id":"e279f5e","elType":"container","settings":{"content_width":"full","flex_justify_content":"center","hover_parallax":[{"layer_position_vr":{"unit":"%","size":30},"layer_position_hr":{"unit":"%","size":40},"_id":"783e648"},{"layer_position_vr":{"unit":"%","size":60},"layer_position_hr":{"unit":"%","size":20},"_id":"e05b6e4"}],"ha_cmc_text":"Happy Addons"},"elements":[{"id":"6725394","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"https:\/\/192.168.224.64\/ccis-ispsc.edu.ph\/wp-content\/uploads\/2025\/06\/BG2C.jpg","id":2081,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"align":"center","_element_width":"inherit","_flex_align_self":"center","ha_cmc_text":"Happy Addons"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"image"}],"isInner":true}],"isInner":false},{"id":"32d5cd9","elType":"container","settings":{"hover_parallax":[{"layer_position_vr":{"unit":"%","size":30},"layer_position_hr":{"unit":"%","size":40},"_id":"ab816cf"},{"layer_position_vr":{"unit":"%","size":60},"layer_position_hr":{"unit":"%","size":20},"_id":"d331a29"}],"ha_cmc_text":"Happy Addons"},"elements":[{"id":"0c805c1","elType":"widget","settings":{"title":"Program Outcomes","align":"center","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Ubuntu Mono","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":24,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_weight":"bold","ha_cmc_text":"Happy Addons","__globals__":{"typography_typography":"","title_color":"globals\/colors?id=f017b68"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"},{"id":"4b1c3ff","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"
    1. Applying knowledge and computing fundamentals, knowledge of a computing specialization, and mathematics, science, and domain knowledge appropriate for the computing specialization to the abstraction and conceptualization of computing models from defined problems and requirements.<\/span><\/li>
    2. Identify, analyze, formulate, research literature, and solve complex computing problems and requirements reaching substantiated conclusions using fundamental principles of mathematics, computing sciences, and relevant domain disciplines.<\/span><\/li>
    3. Apply mathematical foundations, algorithmic principles and computing problems and design of computer-based systems in a way that demonstrates comprehension of the tradeoffs involved in designs choices.<\/span><\/li>
    4. Display knowledge and understanding of information security issues in relation to design, development and use of information.<\/span><\/li>
    5. Design and evaluate solutions for complex computing problems, and design and evaluate system, components, or processes that meet specified needs with appropriate considerations.<\/span><\/li>
    6. Create, select, adapt and apply appropriate techniques, resources and modern computing tools to complex computing activities, with an understanding of the limitations to accomplish a common goal.<\/span><\/li>
    7. Function effectively as an individual and as a member or leader in diverse teams and in multidisciplinary settings<\/span><\/li>
    8. Communicate effectively with the computing community and with society at large about complex computing activities by being able to comprehend and write effective reports, design documentation, make effective presentation, and give and understand clear instructions.<\/span><\/li>
    9. Recognize the legal, social and professional issues involved in the utilization of computer technology and be guide by the adoption of appropriate professional, ethical and legal practices.<\/span><\/li>
    10. Engage in independent learning of continual development as a computing professional.<\/span><\/li><\/ol>","align":"justify","text_color":"#000000","_flex_size":"none","ha_cmc_text":"Happy Addons","__globals__":{"typography_typography":"globals\/typography?id=958ae6f"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":false},{"id":"e13d87b","elType":"container","settings":{"container_type":"grid","grid_columns_grid":{"unit":"fr","size":"2"},"grid_rows_grid":{"unit":"fr","size":"1"},"grid_rows_grid_mobile":{"unit":"fr","size":"1"},"hover_parallax":[{"layer_position_vr":{"unit":"%","size":30},"layer_position_hr":{"unit":"%","size":40},"_id":"9e016bc"},{"layer_position_vr":{"unit":"%","size":60},"layer_position_hr":{"unit":"%","size":20},"_id":"2c2710a"}],"ha_cmc_text":"Happy       1. Secure Application Form<\/b>: Obtain the application form from the ISPSC Main Campus Admissions Office or download it from our website.<\/span><\/li>
      2. Submit Requirements<\/b>: Submit the accomplished application form along with all required documents to the Admissions Office.<\/span><\/li>
      3. Schedule Entrance Exam<\/b>: The Admissions Office will provide you with a schedule and details for the (ICAT).<\/span><\/li>
      4. Take the Entrance Exam<\/b>: Be present on your scheduled date and time for the ICAT.<\/span><\/li>
      5. Interview (if applicable)<\/b>: Some programs, especially within CCIS, may require an interview as part of the admission process to assess aptitude and interest.<\/span><\/li>
      6. Release of Results<\/b>: Check the official ISPSC Main Campus bulletin boards or website for the list of qualified applicants on [Specify Date].<\/span><\/li>
      7. item.title: Hello world!

item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Blog Home
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Computing and Information Sciences

Where Logic Meets Innovation

About us

CCIS BULLETIN

Dive into the world of CCIS with our newest bulletin!

Hello, Real World: Day One of OJT

Today marks the highly anticipated first day of my On-the-Job Training, a pivotal moment where I'll transition from theory to practical application, eager to learn and contribute in a real-world setting.

Read more

Crack the Code: The Ultimate Challenge

This highly anticipated event invites participants to delve into a series of intricate problems, challenging their logic, coding efficiency, and innovative thinking.

Read more

CS Ball: A Night of Connection

CS Ball: A Night of Connection is an exclusive formal event designed to bring together the brightest minds in Computer Science for an evening of networking, camaraderie, and celebration beyond the screens.

Read more
See more

PROGRAMS OFFERED

College of Computing and Information Sciences offers 3 main programs

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

Today marks the highly anticipated first day of my On-the-Job Training, a pivotal moment where I'll transition from theory to practical application, eager to learn and contribute in a real-world setting.

Learn more

Bachelor of Science in Information Technology

This exciting event challenges participants with complex puzzles that test logic, coding skills, and creativity from tricky ciphers to tough optimization tasks.

Learn more

ANNOUNCEMENTS

Stay Connected: What's Happening in CCIS!

Announcement

CCIS ENROLLMENT SCHEDULE
1ST SEMESTER - ACADEMIC YEAR 2025-2026

BS Computer Science - June 23 - 27, 2025

BS Information Technology - June 30 - July 4, 2025

BS Information System - July 7 - July 11, 2025

School Calendar

CCIS and the UN Sustainable Development Goals

See how the College of Computing and Information Sciences integrates the UN Sustainable Development Goals into its core mission, leveraging logic and innovation to create impactful solutions for a more sustainable and equitable planet.

CONTACT US

Stay Connected: What's Happening in CCIS!

A

sk how we can help you?

We’d love to hear from you. Whether you have questions, feedback, or just want to say hi, our team is here and ready to listen. Fill out the form beside this message, and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can. Let’s connect and make things happen — together.

First Name
Last Name
Email
Message

item.title: Welcome to the Gutenberg Editor
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Of Mountains & Printing Presses

The goal of this new editor is to make adding rich content to WordPress simple and enjoyable. This whole post is composed of pieces of content—somewhat similar to LEGO bricks—that you can move around and interact with. Move your cursor around and you’ll notice the different blocks light up with outlines and arrows. Press the arrows to reposition blocks quickly, without fearing about losing things in the process of copying and pasting.

What you are reading now is a text block the most basic block of all. The text block has its own controls to be moved freely around the post...

... like this one, which is right aligned.

Headings are separate blocks as well, which helps with the outline and organization of your content.

A Picture is Worth a Thousand Words

Handling images and media with the utmost care is a primary focus of the new editor. Hopefully, you’ll find aspects of adding captions or going full-width with your pictures much easier and robust than before.

Try selecting and removing or editing the caption, now you don’t have to be careful about selecting the image or other text by mistake and ruining the presentation.

The Inserter Tool

Imagine everything that WordPress can do is available to you quickly and in the same place on the interface. No need to figure out HTML tags, classes, or remember complicated shortcode syntax. That’s the spirit behind the inserter—the (+) button you’ll see around the editor—which allows you to browse all available content blocks and add them into your post. Plugins and themes are able to register their own, opening up all sort of possibilities for rich editing and publishing.

Go give it a try, you may discover things WordPress can already add into your posts that you didn’t know about. Here’s a short list of what you can currently find there:

  • Text & Headings
  • Images & Videos
  • Galleries
  • Embeds, like YouTube, Tweets, or other WordPress posts.
  • Layout blocks, like Buttons, Hero Images, Separators, etc.
  • And Lists like this one of course :)

Visual Editing

A huge benefit of blocks is that you can edit them in place and manipulate your content directly. Instead of having fields for editing things like the source of a quote, or the text of a button, you can directly change the content. Try editing the following quote:

The editor will endeavor to create a new page and post building experience that makes writing rich posts effortless, and has “blocks” to make it easy what today might take shortcodes, custom HTML, or “mystery meat” embed discovery.

Matt Mullenweg, 2017

The information corresponding to the source of the quote is a separate text field, similar to captions under images, so the structure of the quote is protected even if you select, modify, or remove the source. It’s always easy to add it back.

Blocks can be anything you need. For instance, you may want to add a subdued quote as part of the composition of your text, or you may prefer to display a giant stylized one. All of these options are available in the inserter.

You can change the amount of columns in your galleries by dragging a slider in the block inspector in the sidebar.

Media Rich

If you combine the new wide and full-wide alignments with galleries, you can create a very media rich layout, very quickly:

Sure, the full-wide image can be pretty big. But sometimes the image is worth it.

The above is a gallery with just two images. It’s an easier way to create visually appealing layouts, without having to deal with floats. You can also easily convert the gallery back to individual images again, by using the block switcher.

Any block can opt into these alignments. The embed block has them also, and is responsive out of the box:

You can build any block you like, static or dynamic, decorative or plain. Here’s a pullquote block:

If you want to learn more about how to build additional blocks, or if you are interested in helping with the project, head over to the GitHub repository.

Help build Gutenberg

Thanks for testing Gutenberg!

👋

item.title: Major in Embedded System & AI
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Embedded systems and artificial intelligence

The Embedded Systems and Artificial Intelligence (AI) major within the BSCS program focuses on the exciting convergence of intelligent systems and hardware. This specialization equips students with the skills to design, develop, and implement smart, autonomous systems that are integrated directly into devices and environments.

Students will delve into the core concepts of artificial intelligence, including machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, and natural language processing, while also gaining a deep understanding of microcontroller programming, real-time operating systems, sensor integration, and hardware-software co-design for embedded platforms.

This major prepares graduates for cutting-edge roles in the development of smart devices, IoT (Internet of Things) solutions, robotics, autonomous vehicles, industrial automation, and other intelligent systems.

Curriculum

Potential Career Paths:

  • Embedded Software Engineer
  • AI Engineer
  • Machine Learning Engineer
  • IoT Developer
  • Robotics Engineer
  • Firmware Developer
  • Automated Systems Designer
  • Hardware-Software Integration Engineer

item.title: Major in Embedded Systems & AI
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Software engineering

The Software Engineering major within the BSCS program provides a comprehensive and systematic approach to the design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of high-quality software solutions. This specialization emphasizes engineering principles, methodologies, and tools to build robust, scalable, and secure software applications.

Students will gain proficiency in various programming paradigms, software architecture, database management, web development, mobile application development, and software project management. The curriculum also focuses on best practices for collaborative development, quality assurance, and software lifecycle management.

This major prepares graduates for critical roles in the software development industry, equipping them with the skills to lead and contribute to complex software projects across various platforms and domains.

Curriculum

Potential Career Paths:

  • Software Engineer / Developer
  • Full-Stack Developer
  • Front-End Developer
  • Back-End Developer
  • Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer
  • DevOps Engineer
  • Solutions Architect
  • Database Administrator
  • Technical Project Manager
